metadata.Title: CVE-2014-6393 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: The Express web framework before 3.11 and 4.x before 4.5 for Node.js does not provide a charset field in HTTP Content-Type headers in 400 level responses, which might allow remote attackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via characters in a non-standard encoding.

criterions.comment: node-express package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.16.4-1').
